009package imagingbook.common.mser.components;
010
011import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
012import java.io.PrintStream;
013import java.util.ArrayList;
014import java.util.Arrays;
015import java.util.Collection;
016import java.util.Collections;
017import java.util.Comparator;
018import java.util.HashSet;
019import java.util.LinkedList;
020import java.util.List;
021import java.util.Set;
022
023import imagingbook.common.mser.components.PixelMap.Pixel;
024
025/**
026 * This class represents a connected component (i.e., a binary image region).
027 * Instances of this class form the nodes of a {@link ComponentTree}.
028 *
029 * @param <T> the type of properties that can be attached to instances of this class
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2022/11/19
032 */
033public class Component<T> {
034        
035        /** The ID number of this component (only used for debugging). */
036        public final int ID;
037        
038        // ------------------------------------------------------------
039        
040        private final int level;                                // intensity level associated with this region
041        private final List<Pixel> points;               // local points in this component (does not include points in child components) 
042        private int size;                                               // the total size of this component (number of points, includes children) 
043        
044        private Component<T> parent;                    // reference to the parent component (null if this is the root)
045        private Component<T> shortcut;                  // reference to a component in the same tree but closer to the root
046        private final Set<Component<T>> children; // the components at the next lower level
047        private int height;                                             // the height of the sub-tree rooted at this component
048        
049        private T properties = null;                    // additional component properties to be attached
050
051        // ------------------------------------------------------------
052        
053        /**
054         * Constructor.
055         * @param level the maximum pixel value in this component
056         * @param id a unique component id (assigned by the factory)
057         */
058        protected Component(int level, int id) {
059                this.ID = id;
060                this.level = level;
061                this.points = new LinkedList<>();
062                this.parent = null;
063                this.shortcut = null;
064                this.children = new HashSet<>();
065                this.size = 0;
066                this.height = 0;
067        }
068        
069        // --------------------------------------------------------
070        
071        /**
072         * Returns the parent component of this component ({@code null} if this node is
073         * the tree's root).
074         * 
075         * @return the parent component
076         */
077        public Component<T> getParent() {
078                return parent;
079        }
080
081        void setParent(Component<T> parent) {
082                this.parent = parent;
083                this.shortcut = parent;
084        }
085        
086        void addToSize(int sizeInc) {
087                size = size + sizeInc;
088        }
089
090        /**
091         * Returns the size (number of pixels) of this component.
092         * 
093         * @return the size of this component
094         */
095        public int getSize() {
096                return size;
097        }
098        
099        void addChild(Component<T> c) {
100                children.add(c);
101        }
102        
103        /**
104         * Returns the list of this component's child components.
105         * 
106         * @return a (possibly empty) list of components, never {@code null}
107         */
108        public Collection<Component<T>> getChildren() {
109                if (children == null) {
110                        return Collections.emptyList();
111                }
112                else {
113                        return children;
114                }
115        }
116
117        /**
118         * Returns the level (max. gray value) of this component.
119         * 
120         * @return the component's level
121         */
122        public int getLevel() {
123                return this.level;
124        }
125        
126        void addPoint(Pixel p) {
127                points.add(p);
128                size = size + 1;
129        }
130        
131        /**
132         * Returns the height of the sub-tree which this component is the root of.
133         * 
134         * @return the height of the sub-tree rooted by this component
135         */
136        public int getHeight() {
137                return this.height;
138        }
139        
140        void setHeight(int newHeight) {
141                height = newHeight;
142        }
143        
144        /**
145         * Returns a list of "local" pixels that directly belong to this component All
146         * these pixels have the same 'level' as the component itself.
147         * 
148         * @return the component's local pixels
149         */
150        public Collection<Pixel> getLocalPixels() {
151                return this.points;
152        }
153        
154        /**
155         * Returns a collection of all pixels of this component, including the
156         * component's local pixels and the pixels of all child components. Not needed
157         * in actual code, used only for debugging.
158         * 
159         * @return all pixels contained in this component
160         */
161        public Collection<Pixel> getAllPixels() {
162                Collection<Pixel> compPoints = this.getChildPixels();
163                compPoints.addAll(this.points);
164                return compPoints;
165        }
166        
167//      public Collection<Pixel> getAllPixels() {
168//              Collection<Pixel> allPoints = new ArrayList<>(this.size);
169//              allPoints.addAll(this.points);
170//              allPoints.addAll(this.getChildPixels());
171//              return allPoints;
172//      }
173        
174        /**
175         * Returns a collection of all pixels contained in the children of this
176         * component.
177         * 
178         * @return all pixels from child components
179         */
180        public Collection<Pixel> getChildPixels() {
181                Collection<Pixel> childPoints = new ArrayList<>(this.size);
182                for (Component<T> child : this.children) {
183                        childPoints.addAll(child.getAllPixels());
184                }
185                return childPoints;
186        }
187        
188        /**
189         * Sets the properties of this component.
190         * 
191         * @param properties a property object (of type T)
192         */
193        public void setProperties(T properties) {
194                this.properties = properties;
195        }
196        
197        /**
198         * Returns the properties attached to this component.
199         * @return the properties attached to this component
200         */
201        public T getProperties() {
202                return properties;
203        }
204        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
205        
206        /**
207         * Recursively locates the root of the tree that contains this component,
208         * returning the first ancestor node that has no parent, which my be this node
209         * itself. The {@link #shortcut} field is used to quickly move up to nodes
210         * closer to the root. The {@link #shortcut} field is updated "on the way back",
211         * i.e., by the unwinding recursion.
212         * 
213         * @return the root of the sub-tree containing this component
214         */
215        Component<T> findRoot() {
216                if (this.isRoot()) {
217                        return this;
218                }
219                else {
220                        shortcut = shortcut.findRoot(); // unwinding recursion updates shortcut 
221                        return shortcut;
222                }
223        }
224        
225        /**
226         * Returns {@code true} if this component is the root of the associated
227         * {@link ComponentTree}.
228         * 
229         * @return {@code true} if this component is the root
230         */
231        public boolean isRoot() {       // TODO: change/clean/check!
232                return parent == null; // || this.parent == this;
233        }
234        
235        /**
236         * Returns {@code true} if this component represents an extremal region.
237         * 
238         * @return {@code true} if the component is extremal
239         */
240        public boolean isExtremal() {
241                return isRoot() || parent.level > this.level;
242        }
243        
244        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
245        
246//      @Override
247//      public int compareTo(Component<?> other) {
248//              return Integer.compare(this.level, other.level);
249//      }       
250        
251        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
252        
253        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
254        private String listChildIds() {
255                int[] ids = new int[this.children.size()];
256                int i = 0;
257                for (Component<T> child : children) {
258                        ids[i] = child.ID;
259                        i++;
260                }
261                return Arrays.toString(ids);
262        }
263        
264        
265        /**
266         * Sorts a list of Components by (decreasing) component size, i.e., the largest
267         * component (with the most pixels) becomes the first.
268         * 
269         * @param components a list of {@link Component} instances
270         */
271        public static void sortBySize(List<? extends Component<?>> components) {
272                Comparator<Component<?>> cmp = new Comparator<Component<?>>() {
273                        @Override
274                        public int compare(Component<?> mser1, Component<?> mser2) {
275                                return Integer.compare(mser2.getSize(), mser1.getSize());
276                        }
277                };
278                Collections.sort(components, cmp);
279        }
280        
281        /**
282         * Sorts a list of Components by (increasing) component level, i.e., the
283         * component with the lowest level becomes the first.
284         * 
285         * @param components a list of {@link Component} instances
286         */
287        public static void sortByLevel(List<? extends Component<?>> components) {
288                Comparator<Component<?>> cmp = new Comparator<Component<?>>() {
289                        @Override
290                        public int compare(Component<?> mser1, Component<?> mser2) {
291                                return Integer.compare(mser1.level, mser2.level);
292                        }
293                };
294                Collections.sort(components, cmp);
295        }
296        
297
298        // ---------------------------
299        
300        void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
301                strm.format("Component %d(%d): size=%d locPts=%d chldPts=%d allPts=%d parent=%s",
302                                this.ID, this.level, 
303                                this.size,
304                                this.points.size(),
305                                this.getChildPixels().size(),
306                                this.getAllPixels().size(),
307                                (this.parent == null) ? "x" : (this.parent.ID + "(" + this.parent.level + ")")
308                                );
309        }
310        
311        @Override
312        public String toString() {
313                ByteArrayOutputStream os = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
314                PrintStream ps = new PrintStream(os);
315                this.printToStream(ps);
316                return os.toString();
317        }
318        
319}
